content: this would become so much easier if codingame allowed require 'numbers_and_words' but it was still very fun

This is fun. :)

However, I noted in my clash that the stub generator text has different separators for English/Spanish, which was cumbersome:

"STATEMENT
English 0 thru 9 is zero one two three four five six seven eight nine
Spanish 0 thru 9 is cero, uno, dos, tres, cuatro, cinco, seis, siete, ocho, nueve"

Best to stick to one. Fun challenge overall.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Â¡Divertido puzzle!

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Everything is fine for me! I do not see any ambiguity.

Can we please be consistent with the separators in the stub? Can we use either spaces or commas for both languages?

This is what it currently is,
English 0 thru 9 is zero one two three four five six seven eight nine
Spanish 0 thru 9 is cero, uno, dos, tres, cuatro, cinco, seis, siete, ocho, nueve

Input section
* Please mention that [[number]] is a non-negative integer.

Output section
* Please delete "Next".

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

* Did you intentionally include commas in Spanish and exclude them in English?

Cases
* Suggest to add case(s) where number = 0.

* ... actually, why is digit 0 not tested at the moment?

Thanks.

You are tooo fast :)

Yes, I had already noticed some of these... working on it now... stay tuned :)

hi Real Robin --
Thanks for the feedback and suggestion.

This clash is so easy that I was using that minor inconsistency to add a bit more complexity.

I suppose if a dozen other feedbacks also tell me that I really must make them exactly the same format, then I will, but let's just leave it like this for now.  

I've been studying data analytics and it talks a lot about how to clean the input to put it in a proper format.  This lets you practice that.

I agree 100% with Robin. There is no point in making the SOLUTION be less clear.

If you  were trying to require more robust code during the parsing phase, I could see your point, but even then the assignment should specify that parsing needs to be robust.
It's just a coincidence that I noticed your contribution and commented on it ðŸ˜‚ It's not like I refresh the page every second to see if any new contribution pops up!
Well, I'm going to continue to imagine that your world does revolve around my contributions.  I need at least one person to exist like that :)

re: * Did you intentionally include commas in Spanish and exclude them in English?
yes, just to add a tiny bit more complexity to this otherwise, pretty simple Clash

re: Cases
* Suggest to add case(s) where number = 0.
* ... actually, why is digit 0 not tested at the moment?

That idiot woman who wrote the test-case generators (me) forgot to include that.  I've given her a stern-warning now and fixed it ;)

re Output section
* Please delete "Next".

Apparently I am just NEVER EVER EVER going to remember this  
I do it EVERY time.  Thanks for your patience.

I think I have fixed everything now (and added another case)  
Would you please review thoroughly again.

(as always thanks for your thoughtful review of mine and other puzzles.  You're amazing and amazingly-dedicated!!)
OK now, and thank you for your comments too! ðŸ˜„
